t: This chapter is an acrostic poem, the verses of which begin with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet.
1:14*r Most Hebrew manuscripts; many Hebrew manuscripts and Septuagint He*i kept*i watch*i over*i my*i sins*i
1:15*r Or has*i set*i a*i time*i for*i me*i /*i when*i he*i will*i
2:1*r Or How*i the*i Lord*i in*i his*i anger*i /*i has*i treated*i Daughter*i Zion*i with*i contempt*i
2:3*r Or off*i /*i all*i the*i strength*i ; or every*i king*i
This chapter is an acrostic poem; the verses of each stanza begin with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet, and the verses within each stanza begin with the same letter.
This chapter is an acrostic poem, the verses of which begin with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet.
